{{also|绝对}}
==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ぜつ|k1=ぜっ|たい|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Indeterminate. {{etyl|ltc|-}} did have the term {{m|ltc|絕對}} ({{IPAchar|/dzjwet twojH/}}), using the older forms of these same characters, but this apparently meant “''to [[lose]] one's [[spouse]], to be [[widowed]]''”. Use of this term to mean “{{m|en|absolute}}” may only date back two centuries, though whether it was recoined in China, Japan, or elsewhere remains unclear.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-pron|ぜったい}}

===Adjectival noun===
{{ja-adj|decl=na|ぜったい|kyu=絕對}}

# [[absolute]]
# [[unlimited]]

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|ぜったい}}

====Usage notes====
Seldom used on its own as an adjective, but more commonly in compounds. On its own, more often used adverbially as {{lang|ja|絶対}}{{l|ja|に}} (''zettai ni''). More often used adjectivally as {{lang|ja|絶対的}} (''zettai teki'').

====Synonyms====
* {{l|ja|無条件}}

====Antonyms====
* {{l|ja|条件付き}}（en: [[conditional]]）
* {{l|ja|相対}}, {{l|ja|相対的}}（en: [[relative]]）

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ぜったい|kyu=絕對}}

# [[absoluteness]], an [[absolute#Noun|absolute]], [[unlimitedness]]

===Synonyms===
* {{l|ja|無比}}
* {{l|ja|無限}}

* {{l|ja|相対}}（en: [[relativity]]）
